item.title: In the car park behind shops on Chalk Farm Road, NW1 8AG, 28th January
item.description:
The car park behind our homes on the Leybourne Street estate has not been maintained for years. Rubbish has accumulated, prompting rodent infestation; trees and other foliage have grown to the extent that they are causing damage to boundary fences/walls, threatening structural damage to properties, causing hazard with falling branches, while residents are continuously having to clear shed leaves. The car park is on land owned by Camden council, which allows shop owners on Chalk Farm Road to make use of the space for their vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawley Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gallons of Water Gushing on to Street, 28th January
item.description:
There is a damaged outside tap on the Guinness Trust estate Charnwood House on Charnwood Street . Reported to Guinness 19/01/26 this has not been repaired . This is not a trickle it is gallons of water 24/7 being wasted .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charnwood Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
